page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: {Fulmer}has evidence of settlement dating back to 150AD.It is set in a hollow surrounded by wooded slopes. In 1979 South Bucks District Council designated Fulmer as a {Conservation {Area.}Despite it's nearness to the M25 and M40 it remains a small,picturesque village. The village is surrounded by open countryside much of which is grazing. It has a large{equestrian centre}on it's edge. Many of the trees and woodland around the village are subject to{Tree Preservation Orders. { }Three buildings are listed as being of{special architectural or historic {interest--}The parish Church,Fulmer Hall and Fulmer Cottage. All the black and white cottages are pretty,The Black Horse pub attracts visitors from miles away and Fulmer House and Fulmer Place are also worth seeing.
